ExperienceSummary.Description: ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~   is experienced in the management of:  Information Technology (Config Deploy Upgrade Migrate); and Business Operations and General Business (General Skills and Activities).    ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~   has 14 years of work experience, with 8 years of management experience, including a mid-level position.
ExperienceSummary.ManagementStory:
Starting on 5/1/2018, the candidate held the following mid-level management position for 8 months:
	Title: Campaign Manager for InCoStrat, Erbil, Iraq
Starting on 8/1/2017, the candidate held the following low-level management position for 9 months:
	Title: Project Manager for The Royal Air Force
Starting on 1/1/2016, the candidate held the following low-level management position for 2 years:
	Title: Intelligence Advise and Assist Deputy Head and Cultural Advisor, Iraq / UK for The Royal Air Force
Starting on 4/1/2017, the candidate held the following low-level management position for 4 months:
	Title: Middle East & North Africa Cultural Advisor for Ministry of Defence
Starting on 1/1/2014, the candidate held the following low-level management position for 3 years:
	Title: Middle East and North Africa Cultural Advisor - Gender Trainer for Women Peace and Security
Starting on 1/1/2013, the candidate held the following mid-level management position for 2 years:
	Title: Aerospace Battle Manager, Airspace Coordinator for National Air Defence Operation Centre
Starting on 1/1/2011, the candidate held the following low-level management position for 2 years:
	Title: Identification Officer (Operations), Team Leader, RAF Scampton and Falkland Islands for The Royal Air Force
ExperienceSummary.AttentionNeeded: ATTENTION: The candidate appears to have been in management in a past role (Campaign Manager for InCoStrat), but was not in management in the most recent role as Consultant Analyst for PA Consulting.

Positions.Description:
Clients: Women in Defence UK, Ministry of Defence, Home Office and a National Security Client
KEY ACHIEVEMENTS
•   Operation model design of adaptive ways of working for a National Security Client using Agile methods.
•   Developed the 2020 Communications Plan for Women in Defence UK, including COVID-related updates.
•   Managed a team of 158 contractors in the provision of effective client-side support as part of a satellite integration project.
•   Planned and integrated communications and training campaign for the department-wide integration of two new software systems.

RESPONSIBILITIES
• Operation model design with 14 sub-teams, integrating hybrid working resulting in cost savings of £3 m per year.
• Developing weekly communications plans and hosting key stakeholder meetings to update on Awards 2020 progress.
• Devised communications strategy, created content and training material as part of a change management project supporting the implementation of two new data management case working systems within three directorates of the UK Home Office.

Defence Equipment and Support
KEY ACHIEVEMENTS
• Identifying opportunities for the acceleration of the implementation of a capability for UK defence platforms within a £300 m project.
• Leading a newly formed training cell, coordinating training for the company's defence team.

KEY ACHIEVEMENTS
• Development, analysis and evaluation of strategic communication influence and behavioural change social media campaigns.
• Created and implemented editorial guidelines, a new HR reporting system, and campaign delivery and planning procedures.

RESPONSIBILITIES
• Leading a team of 24 staff, providing strategic direction and project campaign development and coordination in addition to welfare
support of a multi-year Countering Violent Extremism project valued at £12 m.
• Regular Subject Matter Expert, partner, and international client liaison, informing strategy development and campaign direction.
• Use of audience insights and analytics to inform strategy development and communication planning on a daily basis.

Spearheading the merger of first level training for three aerospace career streams and seven sub-specialisations to streamline
processes, realise cost-savings and reduce training times.

RESPONSIBILITIES
• Managing four aerospace control subject matter experts to develop transformative integrated training systems, utilising current
training processes and materials to improve and optimise the standard of training and to centralise training location.
• Accountable for managing all daily queries, providing status updates to key stakeholders and resolving arising issues.

JobTitle.Raw: Intelligence Advise and Assist Deputy Head and Cultural Advisor, Iraq / UK
JobTitle.Normalized: Intelligence Advise and Assist Deputy Head and Cultural Advisor Iraq UK
Variations: Intelligence Advise and Assist Deputy Head and Cultural Advisor
Intelligence Advise and Assist Deputy Head and Cultural Advisor, Iraq

Positions.Description:
KEY ACHIEVEMENTS
• Significantly improved communication and information sharing, resulting in substantial time and cost savings through conceptualising
and implementing new air operating procedures, negotiating with key stakeholders and training personnel.
• Advanced cultural understanding and improved collaboration between partners by effectively advising US-led multinational
headquarters on communication strategy and contributing to the planning process.
• Identified the necessity for improved cultural training for UK personnel working with Iraqi-Kurdish partners, devised and delivered a
research project where results were adopted for best practice pre-deployment training and planning.

RESPONSIBILITIES
• Successfully increased Iraqi military intelligence capacity and delivered behavioural change through effectively collaborating with Iraqi
Intelligence representatives, in an advisory role, with daily leadership engagement and managing an international team.
• Delivered comprehensive briefing updates at board level as a liaison officer and effectively disseminated regular reports, supporting
UK decision-making at Parliamentary level.

JobTitle.Raw: Middle East & North Africa Cultural Advisor
JobTitle.Normalized: Middle East AND North Africa Cultural Advisor

Positions.Description:
Strategy Alignment Project, Monitoring & Evaluation
KEY ACHIEVEMENTS
• Successfully leveraged field expertise to develop an area-specific strategy and coordination structure, through liaison with key
stakeholders, resulting in reduced decision-making timelines, cost-savings and increased team engagement and collaboration.
• Conceptualised and delivered a proposal, later used as a template for projects conducted in areas outside the Middle East and North
Africa, aimed at quantifying the effect of influence, stabilisation and training projects valued at £17 million.

RESPONSIBILITIES
• Ensured UK MOD strategy aligned to objectives by regularly engaging with key stakeholders and conducting cross-Whitehall liaison.

JobTitle.Raw: Middle East and North Africa Cultural Advisor - Gender Trainer
JobTitle.Normalized: Middle East and North Africa Cultural Advisor Gender Trainer
Variations: Middle East and North Africa Cultural Advisor

Positions.Description:
KEY ACHIEVEMENTS
• Significantly improved gender awareness skillset of staff within an operational environment through delivering informative gender
training aligned to UN Resolution 1325 (Women Peace and Security) whilst ensuring training aligned with MOD policy.

RESPONSIBILITIES
• Provided cultural advice and linguistic support to exercise headquarters and comprehensive leadership lessons to local soldiers.
• Led gender training workshops and delivered tailored pre-deployment training to deploying staff.

KEY ACHIEVEMENTS AND RESPONSIBILITIES
• Instrumental in developing the airspace control plan for the Glasgow Commonwealth Games 2014 and 2014 NATO Summit.
• Coordinated operational airspace and liaised with Government, police and NATO elements whilst mitigating potential risks.

JobTitle.Raw: Identification Officer (Operations), Team Leader, RAF Scampton and Falkland Islands
JobTitle.Normalized: Identification Officer Operations Team Leader RAF Scampton and Falkland Islands
Variations: Team Leader, RAF Scampton and Falkland Islands

Findings.Message: You should not use the PDF format for your resume. Due to inherent limitations with text extraction from PDFs, you are less likely to get a job when using a PDF resume.
A street level address was not found in the contact information. A full contact address should always be included in a resume as it allows for location based searches.
Every position in a resume should have a job title.
Every position in a resume should have an employer name.
Every degree in a resume should have a name or type associated with it, such as 'B.S.' or 'M.S.'.
High school (or lower) education should not be included on resumes that contain higher-level education.

ResumeMetadata.PlainText:
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~  
   ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~  
Communication   Change Management   Project	in/   ~~~~~~~  /
Management
   ~~~~~~~~  


Professional Profile
A versatile and highly regarded professional, with experience in communications, change and project management. Skilled at defining
and implementing effective strategies in collaboration with key stakeholders, to satisfy organisational objectives. Leverages expertise
to design and deliver innovative solutions whilst ensuring integrity and consistency. Successfully drives, manages and coordinates
resources and processes to ensure delivery is aligned to strategy and communications objectives. Ensures operational efficiency and
productivity through defining and implementing continuous improvement processes. Influences key business decisions through
providing comprehensive and informative insights and guidance. An analytical thinker with critical problem-solving abilities, skilled at
disseminating appropriate information and effecting behavioural change. A confident negotiator and networker with the ability to
maintain and cultivate sustainable working relationships who thrives in challenging and collaborative environments. Holds UK SC.

KEY ACHIEVEMENTS
